title: Sri Lanka conveys condolences over school shooting in Canada
byline: Sri Lanka has expressed deep sorrow over the tragic shooting at a school in British Columbia, Canada.

title: Ten dead after shooter opens fire at Canadian high school in rare massacre
byline: Ten people including the shooter are dead after an assailant opened fire at a high school in western Canada on Tuesday in one of the country’s deadliest mass casualty events in recent history.

title: Australia ready to help Sri Lanka join RCEP-world’s largest free trade zone
byline: Australia is willing to help Sri Lanka join the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) which is the world’s largest free trade agreement covering 15 nations and nearly 30 percent of the global population and GDP, High Commissioner Matthew Duckworth said.

title: CID launches probe into fraudulent emails circulating in Director’s name
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation after fraudulent emails were circulated falsely claiming to be from its Director, Shani Abeysekara.

title: Sri Lanka Navy earns USD 600,000 in four months from OBST operations
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has generated USD 598,250 in foreign exchange revenue within just four (04) months by independently facilitating Onboard Security Team (OBST) operations. This total revenue has been credited to the Government Consolidated Fund for the benefit of the national economy and public welfare.

title: Sri Lankan embassy in Washington DC hosts Buddhist ‘Walk for Peace’
byline: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Washington DC warmly welcomed the ‘Walk for Peace’ on 10 February 2026, a nationwide walk led by Buddhist monks promoting world peace, which drew attention and support from people across the United States and around the globe.

title: SL briefs bondholders on US $ 7.6bn restructured debt in global investor call
byline: The Finance, Planning and Economic Development Ministry concluded a formal briefing yesterday for the international investors, marking a key milestone in the country’s post-restructuring financial transparency.

title: Police identify suspect in Canada mass shooting
byline: Asuspect has been identified in the mass shooting in a remote British Columbia town that left nine people dead, including the person believed to be the attacker.

title: Legal action being taken against unlawful activities in Ambuluwawa: Lal Kantha
byline: The Ministry of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs and the Justice Ministry are in the process of taking legal action against unlawful activities at the Ambuluwawa site in Gampola, Minister Lal Kantha said today.

title: SJB allies are free to do anything on their own: MP Marikkar
byline: Allies of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) are free to do anything on their own in order to maintain their identities, MP S.M. Marikkar said today.

title: Shanaka Rewrites Record Books with 19-Ball Fifty
byline: No byline

title: Dawson’s Creek star James Van Der Beek dies at 48
byline: James Van Der Beek, the star of 1990s teen drama ’’Dawson’s Creek,’’ died on Wednesday at the age of 48 after a battle with cancer, his wife announced on social media.

title: Rupee appreciates slightly against US Dollar
byline: The Sri Lankan Rupee appreciated marginally against the US Dollar at several commercial banks today (Feb 12) compared to Wednesday, with the selling rate remaining steady around Rs. 312.

title: Over One-Third of Sri Lankan Adults Overweight or Obese
byline: Sri Lanka continues to face a growing public health challenge as more than one-third of the country’s adult population is now classified as overweight or obese, according to a national nutrition and diet study conducted by International Food Policy Research Institute and Department of Applied Nutrition, Wayamba University of Sri Lanka.

title: 14th Laksala showroom opened in Negombo
byline: The Sri Lanka Handicrafts Board (Laksala) yesterday (11) inaugurated its 14th showroom in the tourist hub of Negombo, with Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi officiating at the opening.

title: Through Olympic Winter Games, Italy seeks to address the world as a builder of peace, growth, international cooperation
byline: Milano-Cortina 2026 will be a global event, bringing to Italy 3,500 athletes from over 90 countries, competing in 304 events, with an estimated worldwide audience of three billion people. Today’s opening ceremony in Italy will also be attended by around 50 Heads of State and Government from across the world.

title: Russia moves to block WhatsApp in messaging app crackdown
byline: Russia has ’’attempted to fully block’’ WhatsApp in the country, the company said, as the Kremlin continues to tighten restrictions on messaging apps.

title: RDA leaves 9,000 km of national roads off balance sheet
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) has failed to capitalise nearly 75 percent of the Class A and B road network it manages, leaving billions of rupees worth of state assets off its statement of financial position.

title: Elephant chases after Russian woman
byline: A Russian woman who attempted to take a photo of a wild elephant frequenting the Buttala – Kataragama road on Tuesday evening (10) received serious injuries when the jumbo charged her. She was admitted to the Hambantota general hospital

title: Police identify suspect in Canada mass shooting
byline: Asuspect has been identified in the mass shooting in a remote British Columbia town that left nine people dead, including the person believed to be the attacker.

title: Kim Jong Un chooses teen daughter as heir, says Seoul
byline: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has selected his daughter as his heir, South Korea’s spy agency told lawmakers on Thursday.

title: SLMC councillor Sohara loses CMC seat
byline: Sohara Buhari, a member of the Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC), has lost her council seat following disciplinary action taken by her party for violating party directives.

title: Bangladesh elections: BNP leader killed due to violence at polling booth
byline: Violence erupted at several polling booths across Bangladesh on Thursday, leading to the death of a political leader as the voting was underway across the nation, local media reported.

title: Independence celebrations promotes trade, investment, tourism and culture in Beijing
byline: The Diplomatic Reception celebrating the 78th National Independence Day of Sri Lanka was held at St Regis Beijing with the participation of the Diplomatic community, government officials, leaders of state-owned enterprises, Heads of Universities, Think Tanks, representatives of Tourism sectors, cultural and other organizations.

title: Nine FR petitions against Deshabandu’s appointment terminated
byline: Nine Fundamental Rights petitions challenging the appointment of Deshabandu Tennakoon as Inspector General of Police (IGP) were withdrawn before the Supreme Court today, as he no longer holds the office.

title: Those who tried to set fire to Parliament should be sentenced to death: MP
byline: Those who made an attempt to set fire to the Parliamentary complex during the aragalaya should be sentenced to death just like those who killed former MP Amarakeerthi Athokorala, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP S.M. Marikkar said today.

title: Passport and visa services temporarily suspended due to system issue
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has temporarily suspended the issuance of passports and visas due to a technical issue in its system.

title: Three students injured as wall collapses at Borella school
byline: Three students were injured after a wall collapsed at C.W.W. Kannangara College in Borella during renovation work.
